contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Mine District'''|美祢郡|Mine-gun}} was a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Yamaguchi Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On March 20, 2008, the day before its dissolution, the district consisted solely of the towns of [[Mitō, Yamaguchi|Mitō]] (美東町) and [[Shūhō, Yamaguchi|Shūhō]] (秋芳町). ==History== * April 1, 1889 - Due to the municipal status enforcement, the villages of Akagō, Akiyoshi, Ayagi, Beppu, Higashiatsu, Isa, Iwanaga, Kyōwa, Managata, Nishiatsu, Ōda, Ofuku, Ōmine, were formed. (13 villages) * August 1, 1923 - The village of Ōda gained town status to become the town of [[Ōda, Yamaguchi|Ōda]]. (1 town, 12 villages) * January 1, 1924 - The village of Isa gained town status to become the town of [[Isa, Yamaguchi|Isa]]. (2 towns, 11 villages) * May 1, 1939 - The village of Ōmine gained town status to become the town of [[Ōmine, Yamaguchi|Ōmine]]. (3 towns, 10 villages) * March 31, 1954 - The towns of Ōmine, Isa, and the villages of [[Higashiatsu, Yamaguchi|Higashiatsu]], [[Mishiatsu, Yamaguchi|Nishiatsu]], [[Ofuku, Yamaguchi|Ofuku]] merged with the town of Toyotamae from [[Toyoura District, Yamaguchi|Toyoura District]] to form the city of [[Mine, Yamaguchi|Mine]] while leaving Mine District. (1 town, 7 villages) * October 1, 1954 - The towns of Ōda, [[Akagō, Yamaguchi|Akagō]], [[Ayagi, Yamaguchi|Ayagi]], and [[Managata, Yamaguchi|Managata]] merged to form the town of Mitō. (1 town, 4 villages) * April 1, 1955 - The villages of Akiyoshi, Iwanaga, Beppu, and Kyōwa merged to form the town of Shūhō. (2 towns) * March 21, 2008 - The towns of Mitō and Shūhō merged with the city of Mine to form the new city of Mine. Mine District dissolved. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:x-small" !April 1, 1889 !1889 - 1944 !1945 - 2008 !2008 - present |- | style="background-color:#9cf;" | 大田 (village) | style="background-color:#6ff;" | August 1, 1923<br />town status | rowspan="4" style="background-color:#6ff;" | October 1, 1954<br />Mitō (town) | rowspan="13" | March 21, 2008<br/ >Mine City |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 赤郷 (village) |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 綾木 (village) |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 真長田 (village) |- | style="background-color:#9cf;" | 大嶺 (village) | style="background-color:#6ff;" | May 1, 1939<br />town status | rowspan="5" | March 31, 1954<br />Mine City |- | style="background-color:#9cf;" | 伊佐 (village) | style="background-color:#6ff;" | January 1, 1924<br />town status |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 東厚保 (village) |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 西厚保 (village) |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 於福 (village) |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 秋吉 (village) | rowspan="4" style="background-color:#6ff;" | April 1, 1955<br />Shūhō (town) |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 岩永 (village) |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 別府 (village) |- | colspan="2" style="background-color:#9cf;" | 共和 (village) |} ==See also== *[[List of dissolved districts of Japan]] [[Category:Former districts of Yamaguchi Prefecture]]
